posts.cooked:
Is there a way to step through a sequence of commands every time a button is pressed?

e.g. I have three commands:  CommandA, CommandB, and CommandC. I want CommandA to continuously run. When a button is pressed, CommandB will continuously run. When the same button is pressed, CommandC will continuously run.

posts.name: Gal
posts.cooked: You can use deafult command and a function that returns one command at time and when the button is pressed it would return a diffrent command.

posts.name: kylelanman
posts.cooked: In your sequence of commands have every other command be a WaitUntil command. The condition for the command should be rising edge of button.

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
The Default Command of a subsystem is the command that is scheduled to run when no other commands are scheduled to run .

So your default scheduling stack looks like this:

If you were to bind scheduling command to a button press trigger for command B, say via onTrue() then when the button is pressed B is scheduled.

Now your scheduling stack looks like this:

If you also bound a button to schedule C, when that button is pressed, B will be removed from the stack, and C will be added so the scheduling will look like this:

With regard to why you want a button press to toggle between two commands, that is up for discussion.  I think that is generally a bad idea for the operator to have to mentally track the state of a subsystem.  So there may be an alternative way to get done what you wish, without explicitly having a toggle between the two commands.  At this point in the discussion, it’s probably best to explain what your intent is for actions, to see if anyone has any opinions as to how to get that done.

posts.name: coderkevin
posts.cooked: This is how our climb sequence works. The driver presses the same button over and over and checks the status of the robot along the way.  Our co-driver has a cancel button which cancels all running commands, so they can abort the climb if needed.

NewtonCrosby:

At this point in the discussion, it’s probably best to explain what your intent is for actions, to see if anyone has any opinions as to how to get that done.

Stepping through a climb sequence
Thanks everyone for your suggestions, I think this helps push us in the right direction.
